headline.main: From the Ladies' Visitor of this City.; MOTHERS,

docs.snippet: The Montgomery Mail of the 10th says: "Col. J. PATTON ANDERSON, First Florida Regiment, now stationed near Pensacola, arrived in our city this morning, en route for the springs, for the benefit of his health.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Montgomery Mail of the 10th says: "Col. J. PATTON ANDERSON, First Florida Regiment, now stationed near Pensacola, arrived in our city this morning, en route for the springs, for the benefit of his health.

docs.snippet: I presume that most of the particulars of the brilliant success of the Naval expedition to Hatteras Inlet will reach you in advance of this letter. Nevertheless I send you some desultory particulars, which you may not possibly receive from any other...

headline.main: THE VICTORY AT HATTERAS.; ADDITIONAL INTERESTING PARTICULARS. THE NEWS FROM REBEL SOURCES. THE LATEST NEWS FROM HATTERAS. ARRIVAL OF THE FRIGATE MINNISOTA.

docs.lead_paragraph: I presume that most of the particulars of the brilliant success of the Naval expedition to Hatteras Inlet will reach you in advance of this letter. Nevertheless I send you some desultory particulars, which you may not possibly receive from any other source.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; HIGHLY IMPORTANT NEWS A Great National Success at Hatteras Inlet Capture of Forts Hatteras and Clark. Upwards of Seven Hundred Rebels Taken Prisoners. Twenty-five Cannon, a Thousand Stand of Arms, and a Quantity of Munitions and Stores. Three Vessels, One Loaded with Cotton, Hade Prizes. A Number of Rebels Killed and wounded. "NOBODY HURT" ON OUR SIDE. A SERIOUS CHECK TO PRIVATEERS. The Minnesota Coming to New-York with the Prisoners. THE HARRIET LANE AGROUND. SPECIAL DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. SERENADE TO GEN. BUTLER. GEN. FREMONT'S PROCLAMATION. THE EXCKLSIOR BRIGADE. ANOTHER CHANCE. THE REBELS ON MUNSON'S HILL. PASSPORTS. GEN. BUTLER IN WASHINGTON.

docs.snippet: The quarters of the Yankee prisoners still continue to be the picture-gallery of the town. You may always find there a crowd of idlers staring at the grated windows on either side of the street, studying human nature and speculating audibly.

headline.main: WHAT OUR PRISONERS ARE DOING AT RICHMOND.

docs.lead_paragraph: The quarters of the Yankee prisoners still continue to be the picture-gallery of the town. You may always find there a crowd of idlers staring at the grated windows on either side of the street, studying human nature and speculating audibly.

docs.snippet: For three weeks we--the Ohio Seventh--have been almost constantly on the move. We have been at Weston, at Sutton, at Glenville, at Big Birch, here at Cross Lanes, and now, after a forced march to near Gauley Bridge, we are back here again. Consult...

headline.main: WESTERN VIRGINIA; THE OHIO SEVENTH--A FORCED MARCH TO GAULEY AND BACK--POSITION OF THINGS--FLOYD THREATEING GEN. COX--A SKIRMISH, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: For three weeks we--the Ohio Seventh--have been almost constantly on the move. We have been at Weston, at Sutton, at Glenville, at Big Birch, here at Cross Lanes, and now, after a forced march to near Gauley Bridge, we are back here again. Consult the map, and you will see that these places named are on the direct turnpike.

headline.main: THE ATTEMPT TO KIDNAP EX-GOV. THOMAS OF MARYLAND.; THE STATE FORCES. ROYALTY AND REPUBLICANISM. POLITICS IN MAINE. SENATOR, GRIMES OF IOWA. SENATOR WILSON'S CALL. AFFAIRS IN WESTERN VIRGINIA WHAT THEY ARE FIGHTING FOR. TROUBLE IMPENDING IN KENTUCKY. THE TRAITOROUS NEW-YORK JOURNALS IN ST. LOUIS. COTTON AND THE BLOCKADE THE OHIO VOLUNTEER OFFICERS. THE QUESTION OF FUGITIVE SLAVES. PRISONERS OF STATE. AN INCIDENT OF THE BULL RUN BATTLE IMMENSE ENGINES OF WAR. THE AMERICAN LOAN IN CANADA THE ALABAMA ELECTION. SUSPICIOUS. MISCELLANEOUS ITEMS
